subtitle: vvith a discouerie of the abuses and corruption of officers.
title: The Lord Coke his speech and charge
other_titles: L. Cokes charge, giuen at Norwich Assises

notes.value:
"Pricket, although he seems to have heard Coke deliver his charge, only embodied a few vague reminiscences, and is himself responsible for the tract, which is an intemperated villification of the Catholics. Coke repudiated any share in the volume in the preface to the seventh part of his Reports"--DNB, v. 46, p. 348.

Signatures: A-H⁴.

The first leaf is blank.

LC copy contains 2 mounted portraits of Coke, manuscript notes, and mounted clippings on blank pages preceding t.p.

STC (2nd ed.) 5492.4

ESTC S108455

Stamped on t.p. verso: Alexander Gardyne 1883.
